questions.question: At what time of day does the stranger arrive at the house?

choices.answer: Morring
Afternoon
Early Morning
Night

questions.question: How does the father react to the stranger’s request to look around?

choices.answer: Would you like to come inside for a few mins & look around?"
"It is dinner time but you can look around"
"You are welcome to look around"
"Hit the road jack!"

questions.question: When does “Where Is Here?” take place?

choices.answer: On a snowy day
On a rainy day
On a chilly, damp evening at sunset
Late afternoon

questions.question: What does the father announced forcefully. “The visit is over”?

choices.answer: The stranger’s bursting into tears
The stranger’s  request to sit on the basement steps
The statement that there used be a water stain on the wall
The stranger’s entrance into the house

questions.question: In the beginning of “Where Is Here?,”what does the stranger say he would like to do?

choices.answer: poke around
meet the children
take a picture of the house
make an offer to buy the house

questions.question: At the end of “WIH?,”what effect has the stranger’s visit had on the family?

choices.answer: It has left the family sad and tired
It has left the children exited about math
It has left the father and mother quarrelsome  & confused
It has left the father and mother happy about life

questions.question: Which would best characterize the stranger in “WIH?”

choices.answer: He has a good seance of humor
He proves that he is trustworthy & honest
He shows fierce loyalty to his family
He demonstrated mysterious & confusing powers

questions.question: In which of the following places would you be gregarious?

choices.answer: a shop
a party
a library
an office

questions.question: Which of the following is  the best example of the word amiably?

choices.answer: Rob complained to the waiter that his soup was cold
Polly prepared carefully for her role in the school play
Rob offered to share the last piece of cake with Polly
Rob gave a fascinating class presentation on the stars
used for a type of clear plastic
showing no emotion
a device that is used to control electricity
having faint dark streaks or spots
to publicly say that you no longer have an opinion
a ship with square sails and two masts
to think or suppose (something)
avoiding the company of other people; solitary.
extremely delicate &  light that seems too perfect
easily seen or recognized
thick and sweet like syrup
too romantic or emotional
to be better or greater than
very great : to a much greater degree
a kind of paint in which the color is mixed with water
the length, width, height, or depth of something

questions.question: “WIH?” focus on mostly on which of the following?

choices.answer: the precise, mathematical design of the human behavior
the stability of marital relationships
the strong influence of irrational human behaivor

questions.question: The strange in “WIH?” mentions his mother several times - What can we infer?

choices.answer: The stranger  was afraid of his mother
The stranger often fought with his mother
